title: Standard Form
text: The standard form of a quadratic is as follows: $$f(x)={a\left(x-h\right)}^2+k$$
speech: The standard form of a quadratic is as follows:  f of x is equal to a, parentheses x minus h,  squared plus k
pacedSpeech: The standard form of a quadratic is as follows:   f of x is equal to a,  x minus h,  squared plus k

title: Finding $$h$$
text: We can find $$h$$ by using the formula $$\frac{-b}{2} a$$. $$h=\frac{-5}{2}$$
speech: We can find  h  by using the formula , fraction, negative b, over 2,  a .  h is equal to, fraction, negative 5, over 2,
pacedSpeech: by using the formula  , fraction, negative b, over 2,  a
.   h is equal to, fraction, negative 5, over 2,

title: Finding k
text: We can substitue $$x=h$$ into the general form of the quadratic to find k. (-5/2)**2+5(-5/2)-2=k=-8.25
speech: We can substitue  x is equal to h,  into the general form of the quadratic to find k. (-5/2)**2+5(-5/2)-2=k=-8.25
pacedSpeech: We can substitue   x is equal to h,
into the general form of the quadratic to find k. (-5/2)**2+5(-5/2)-2=k=-8.25

title: Rewriting into Standard Form
text: Using the values of $$h$$ and k derived in the previous steps, we can write the equation in standard form. $$f(x)={\left(x+\frac{5}{2}\right)}^2-8.25$$
speech: Using the values of  h  and k derived in the previous steps, we can write the equation in standard form.  f of x, is equal to parentheses, x plus 5 halves,  squared minus 8.25
